Describe core features of a data package

Source: R/template_core_metadata.R
template_core_metadata.Rd

Core information to all data packages (abstract, methods, keywords, personnel, license). Describes what the data are, why and how they were created, who was involved in their creation, and under what license the data are released.

template_core_metadata(
  path,
  license,
  file.type = ".txt",
  write.file = TRUE,
  x = NULL
)

Arguments

path

(character) Path to the metadata template directory.
license

(character) License to publicly release the data package under. Use "CC0" or "CCBY".
file.type

(character; optional) File type for abstract, methods, and additional info metadata templates. Can be: '.txt' (plain text), '.docx' (MS Word), or '.md' (markdown).
write.file

(logical; optional) Whether to write the template files.
x

(named list; optional) Alternative input to template_core_metadatta(). Use template_arguments() to create x.

Value

  • abstract The abstract template.

  • additional_info The template for miscellaneous information.

  • intellectual_rights.txt The intellectual rights license with the text of CC0 or CCBY.

  • keywords.txt The tab delimited keywords template.

  • methods The methods template.

  • personnel.txt The tab delimited personnel template for information on persons and funding involved in the creation of the data package.

  • These files is written to path unless using x, in which case the templates are added to /x/templates.

Details

Existing templates will not be overwritten by template_core_metadata().

Examples

if (FALSE) {
# Set working directory
setwd("/Users/me/Documents/data_packages/pkg_260")

# For data licensed under CC0 and using .docx files for the abstract and methods
template_core_metadata(
  path = "./metadata_templates",
  license = "CC0",
  file.type = ".docx")
}
